required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of Apixaban in Subjects on Hemodialysis
clinical_study.official_title: Single-Dose Study to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, and Safety of Apixaban in Subjects on Hemodialysis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the pharmacokinetics of a single oral dose of 5 mg Apixaban in subjects with normal renal function and subjects with end stage renal disease (ESRD) maintained with hemodialysis.

detailed_description.textblock: Primary Purpose : To provide a clear understanding of the pharmacokinetics of Apixaban in subjects with ESRD and to determine the effect of hemodialysis on Apixaban pharmacokinetics .

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Single 5mg Oral Dose of Apixaban
primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) was measured by plasma concentration of apixaban over time. The geometric means are reported in nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Metabolite BMS-730823
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration (Cmax) was measured by plasma concentration of BMS-730823 over time. The geometric means are reported in nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUC(0-T)) of Single 5mg Oral Dose of Apixaban
primary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to time of the last quantifiable concentration (AUC(0-T)) was measured by plasma concentration of apixaban over time. The geometric means are reported in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*h/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUC(0-T)) of Metabolite BMS-730823
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to time of the last quantifiable concentration (AUC(0-T)) was measured by plasma concentration of BMS-730823 over time. The geometric means are reported in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*h/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time (AUC(INF)) of Single 5mg Oral Dose of Apixaban
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: The area under the concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time (AUC(INF)) was measured by plasma concentration of apixaban over time. The geometric means are reported in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*h/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero Extrapolated to Infinite Time (AUC(INF)) of BMS-730823
primary_outcome.description: The area under the concentration-time curve from time zero extrapolated to infinite time (AUC(INF)) was measured by plasma concentration of BMS-730823 over time. The geometric means are reported in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*h/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Plasma Terminal Half-life (T-Half) of Single 5mg Oral Dose of Apixaban
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Plasma terminal half-life (T-Half) for apixaban was derived from plasma concentrations versus time data. Means were reported in hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Plasma Terminal Half-life (T-Half) of BMS-730823
primary_outcome.description: Mean plasma terminal half-life (T-Half) for BMS-730823 was derived from plasma concentrations versus time data.

primary_outcome.measure: Median Time of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of a Single 5 mg Oral Dose of Apixaban
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Time of maximum observed plasma concentration (Tmax) for apixaban was derived from plasma concentrations versus time data. Medians were reported in hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Median Time of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Metabolite BMS-730823
primary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Time of maximum observed plasma concentration (Tmax) for BMS-730823 was derived from plasma concentrations versus time data. Medians were reported in hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From 2 to 6 Hours (AUC(2-6)) for Apixaban
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 2 hours to 6 hours (AUC(2-6) for Apixaban was measured in participants with ESRD during dialysis in Period 1 only. Geometric Means were reported in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*hr/mL) and were determined from blood samples both entering and exiting the dialyzer.

primary_outcome.measure: Geometric Mean of Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From 2 to 6 Hours (AUC(2-6)) for BMS-730823
primary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 2 hours to 6 hours (AUC(2-6) for BMS-730823 was measured in participants with ESRD during dialysis in Period 1 only. Geometric Means were reported in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*hr/mL) and were determined from blood samples both entering and exiting the dialyzer.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Dose of Apixaban Recovered in Urine (%UR)
primary_outcome.description: The percent dose recovered in urine was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of unchanged apixaban excreted in urine from the time of dose up to 72 hours post-dose by the apixaban dose administered.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Dose of Apixaban Recovered in Dialysate (%DR)
primary_outcome.description: Percent dose of Apixaban recovered in dialysate (%DR) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of apixaban excreted in each dialysate collection over 2-6 hours (DR(2-6)) by the apixaban dose. %DR was recorded only in period 1.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Renal Clearance (CLR) of Apixaban
primary_outcome.description: Renal clearance (CLR) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of apixaban excreted in urine by the respective cumulative plasma AUC over the same urine collection interval. Geometric means were reported in milliliters per minute (mL/min).

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Renal Clearance (CLR) of BMS-730823
primary_outcome.description: Renal clearance (CLR) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of BMS-730823 excreted in urine by the respective cumulative plasma AUC over the same urine collection interval. Geometric means were reported in milliliters per minute (mL/min).

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Hemodialysis Clearance (CLD) of Apixaban
primary_outcome.description: Hemodialysis clearance (CLD) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of apixaban excreted in dialysate by the respective cumulative plasma AUC over the same dialysate collection interval (AUC(2-6) entering). CLD measurements occurred only in period 1. Geometric means were reported in milliliters per minute (mL/min).

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Hemodialysis Clearance (CLD) of BMS-730823
primary_outcome.description: Hemodialysis clearance (CLD) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of BMS-730823 excreted in dialysate by the respective cumulative plasma AUC over the same dialysate collection interval (AUC(2-6) entering). CLD measurements occurred only in period 1. Geometric means were reported in milliliters per minute (mL/min).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Apixaban Extracted During Hemodialysis
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of apixaban extracted during hemodialysis (extraction ratio) was calculated using the formula [plasma AUC(2-6) exiting - AUC(2-6) entering] / [AUC(2-6) entering] and converted to a percentage. The extraction ratio was measured in period 1 only, and was reported as a percentage.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of BMS-730823 Extracted During Hemodialysis
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of BMS-730823 extracted during hemodialysis (extraction ratio) was calculated using the formula [plasma AUC(2-6)exiting - AUC(2-6)entering] / [AUC(2-6) entering] and converted to a percentage. The extraction ratio was measured in period 1 only, and was reported as a percentage.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Maximum Percent Change From Baseline International Normalized Ratio (INR) Following a Single 5 mg Oral Dose of Apixaban
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: The mean maximum percent change in baseline for INR was reported for each arm. Baseline measurements were assessed up to 24 hours prior to Day 1 dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Maximum Percent Change From Baseline Prothrombin Time (PT) Following a Single 5 mg Oral Dose of Apixaban
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: The mean maximum percent change in Prothrombin Time (PT) from baseline was reported for all treated participants. Baseline measurements were assessed up to 24 hours prior to Day 1 dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Maximum Percent Change From Baseline Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT) Following a Single Oral Dose of 5 mg Apixaban
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: The mean maximum percent change in Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time (aPTT) from baseline was reported for all treated participants. Baseline measurements were assessed up to 24 hours prior to Day 1 dosing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Peak Anti-FXa Activity Following a Single Oral Dose of 5 mg Apixaban
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Anti-FXa activity was assessed from an activity-time profile for doses both before and after hemodialysis. Maximal means were reported in International Units per milliliter (IU/mL).

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Laboratory Marked Abnormalities
other_outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose
other_outcome.description: ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx= Baseline value. BUN=Blood Urea Nitrogen (mmol/L=millimoles per Liter): High if BUN > 1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx). Platelet count (*10^9 cell/L): Low if Platelet Count < 0.85*LLN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.85*Pre-Rx). Creatine (umol/L=micromoles per Liter): High if Creatine > 1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.33*Pre-Rx). Calcium, Total (mmol/L): High if Calcium > 1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.33*Pre-Rx). Potassium, serum (mmol/L): High if Potassium > 1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx; if Pre-Rx<LLN: >ULN). Phosphorus, Inorganic (mmol/L): Low if Phosphate < 0.85*LLN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: <LLN). Lactate dehydrogenase (U/L=Units per Liter): High if Lactate Dehydrogenase > 1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.5*Pre-Rx).

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Died or Experienced Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) or Adverse Events Leading to Discontinuation
other_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to 30 days post study discontinuation
other_outcome.description: The number of participants who died or experienced SAEs or AEs leading to discontinuation was reported for each arm. AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization. Treatment-related=having certain, probable, possible, or missing relationship to study drug. Grade (Gr) 1=Mild, Gr 2=Moderate, Gr 3=Severe, Gr 4= Potentially Life-threatening or disabling.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The signed informed consent form.
- Subjects with normal renal function classified based on calculated creatinine clearance (CLCr) determined by the cockcroft-gault calculation.
- Eligible subjects with ESRD that is maintained with chronic and stable hemodialysis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any history of abnormal bleeding or coagulation disorders including those in a first degree relative under 50 years of age.
- History of significant head injury within the last two years.
- Any gastrointestinal surgery that could impact the absorption of study drug.
- Not expected to continue the hemodialysis treatment for the duration of the study.
- INR, PT, or aPTT above the upper limit of normal, unless agreed upon between the investigator and BMS medical monitor.
- History of allergy to Apixaban or Factor Xa inhibitors.

results_reference.citation: Wang X, Tirucherai G, Marbury TC, Wang J, Chang M, Zhang D, Song Y, Pursley J, Boyd RA, Frost C. Pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, and safety of apixaban in subjects with end-stage renal disease on hemodialysis. J Clin Pharmacol. 2016 May;56(5):628-36. doi: 10.1002/jcph.628. Epub 2015 Dec 22.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 18 participants were enrolled in this study. 16 participants were treated and completed the study. Two participants were enrolled but not treated (one withdrew consent, one enrolled as alternate).

group.title: Normal Renal Function
group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function (calculated creatinine clearance (ClCr) > 80 mL/min) received a single oral dose of 5 mg apixaban on the morning of Day 1.

group.title: ESRD Maintained With Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) maintained with hemodialysis received two doses of apixaban separated by a washout period of at least 7 days; one oral dose of 5mg apixaban 2 hours prior to hemodialysis on Day 1 of Period 1, and a second oral dose of 5mg apixaban immediately following the hemodialysis session on Day 1, Period 2.

group.title: Normal Renal Function
group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function (calculated creatinine clearance (ClCr) > 80 mL/min) received a single oral dose of 5 mg apixaban on the morning of Day 1.

group.title: ESRD Maintained With Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) maintained with hemodialysis received two doses of apixaban separated by a washout period of at least 7 days; one oral dose of 5mg apixaban 2 hours prior to hemodialysis on Day 1 of Period 1, and a second oral dose of 5mg apixaban immediately following the hemodialysis session on Day 1, Period 2.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Geometric Mean of Area Under the Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From 2 to 6 Hours (AUC(2-6)) for BMS-730823
measure.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from 2 hours to 6 hours (AUC(2-6) for BMS-730823 was measured in participants with ESRD during dialysis in Period 1 only. Geometric Means were reported in nanogram hours per milliliter (ng*hr/mL) and were determined from blood samples both entering and exiting the dialyzer.
measure.population: All participants with ESRD maintained with hemodialysis

outcome.title: Mean Percent Dose of Apixaban Recovered in Urine (%UR)
outcome.description: The percent dose recovered in urine was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of unchanged apixaban excreted in urine from the time of dose up to 72 hours post-dose by the apixaban dose administered.

group.title: Normal Renal Function
group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function (calculated creatinine clearance (ClCr) > 80 mL/min) received a single oral dose of 5 mg apixaban on the morning of Day 1.

group.title: ESRD Dose Before Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with ESRD received one oral dose of 5 mg apixaban 2 hours prior to hemodialysis.

group.title: ESRD Dose After Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with ESRD received one oral dose of 5 mg apixaban immediately following the completion of hemodialysis.

measure.title: Mean Percent Dose of Apixaban Recovered in Urine (%UR)
measure.description: The percent dose recovered in urine was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of unchanged apixaban excreted in urine from the time of dose up to 72 hours post-dose by the apixaban dose administered.
measure.units: percent of dose recovered in urine

outcome.title: Mean Percent Dose of Apixaban Recovered in Dialysate (%DR)
outcome.description: Percent dose of Apixaban recovered in dialysate (%DR) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of apixaban excreted in each dialysate collection over 2-6 hours (DR(2-6)) by the apixaban dose. %DR was recorded only in period 1.
outcome.population: All treated participants with ESRD maintained with hemodialysis

group.title: ESRD Maintained With Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) maintained with hemodialysis received two doses of apixaban separated by a washout period of at least 7 days; one oral dose of 5mg apixaban 2 hours prior to hemodialysis on Day 1 of Period 1, and a second oral dose of 5mg apixaban immediately following the hemodialysis session on Day 1, Period 2.

measure.title: Mean Percent Dose of Apixaban Recovered in Dialysate (%DR)
measure.description: Percent dose of Apixaban recovered in dialysate (%DR) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of apixaban excreted in each dialysate collection over 2-6 hours (DR(2-6)) by the apixaban dose. %DR was recorded only in period 1.
measure.population: All treated participants with ESRD maintained with hemodialysis
measure.units: percent of dose recovered in dialysate

outcome.title: Mean Renal Clearance (CLR) of Apixaban
outcome.description: Renal clearance (CLR) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of apixaban excreted in urine by the respective cumulative plasma AUC over the same urine collection interval. Geometric means were reported in milliliters per minute (mL/min).

group.title: Normal Renal Function
group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function (calculated creatinine clearance (ClCr) > 80 mL/min) received a single oral dose of 5 mg apixaban on the morning of Day 1.

group.title: ESRD Dose Before Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with ESRD received one oral dose of 5 mg apixaban 2 hours prior to hemodialysis.

group.title: ESRD Dose After Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with ESRD received one oral dose of 5 mg apixaban immediately following the completion of hemodialysis.

measure.title: Mean Renal Clearance (CLR) of Apixaban
measure.description: Renal clearance (CLR) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of apixaban excreted in urine by the respective cumulative plasma AUC over the same urine collection interval. Geometric means were reported in milliliters per minute (mL/min).

outcome.description: Renal clearance (CLR) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of BMS-730823 excreted in urine by the respective cumulative plasma AUC over the same urine collection interval. Geometric means were reported in milliliters per minute (mL/min).

group.title: ESRD Dose After Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with ESRD received one oral dose of 5 mg apixaban immediately following the completion of hemodialysis.

measure.description: Renal clearance (CLR) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of BMS-730823 excreted in urine by the respective cumulative plasma AUC over the same urine collection interval. Geometric means were reported in milliliters per minute (mL/min).

measurement_list.measurement: Parameters cannot be estimated for ESRD group due to functional anuria or below Lower Level of Quantitation (LLOQ)
Parameters cannot be estimated for ESRD group due to functional anuria or below Lower Level of Quantitation (LLOQ)

outcome.title: Mean Hemodialysis Clearance (CLD) of Apixaban
outcome.description: Hemodialysis clearance (CLD) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of apixaban excreted in dialysate by the respective cumulative plasma AUC over the same dialysate collection interval (AUC(2-6) entering). CLD measurements occurred only in period 1. Geometric means were reported in milliliters per minute (mL/min).
outcome.population: All treated participants with ESRD maintained with hemodialysis

group.title: ESRD Maintained With Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) maintained with hemodialysis received two doses of apixaban separated by a washout period of at least 7 days; one oral dose of 5mg apixaban 2 hours prior to hemodialysis on Day 1 of Period 1, and a second oral dose of 5mg apixaban immediately following the hemodialysis session on Day 1, Period 2.

measure.title: Mean Hemodialysis Clearance (CLD) of Apixaban
measure.description: Hemodialysis clearance (CLD) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of apixaban excreted in dialysate by the respective cumulative plasma AUC over the same dialysate collection interval (AUC(2-6) entering). CLD measurements occurred only in period 1. Geometric means were reported in milliliters per minute (mL/min).
measure.population: All treated participants with ESRD maintained with hemodialysis

outcome.title: Mean Hemodialysis Clearance (CLD) of BMS-730823
outcome.description: Hemodialysis clearance (CLD) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of BMS-730823 excreted in dialysate by the respective cumulative plasma AUC over the same dialysate collection interval (AUC(2-6) entering). CLD measurements occurred only in period 1. Geometric means were reported in milliliters per minute (mL/min).
outcome.population: All participants with ESRD maintained with hemodialysis

group.title: ESRD Maintained With Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) maintained with hemodialysis received two doses of apixaban separated by a washout period of at least 7 days; one oral dose of 5mg apixaban 2 hours prior to hemodialysis on Day 1 of Period 1, and a second oral dose of 5mg apixaban immediately following the hemodialysis session on Day 1, Period 2.

measure.title: Mean Hemodialysis Clearance (CLD) of BMS-730823
measure.description: Hemodialysis clearance (CLD) was calculated by dividing the cumulative amount of BMS-730823 excreted in dialysate by the respective cumulative plasma AUC over the same dialysate collection interval (AUC(2-6) entering). CLD measurements occurred only in period 1. Geometric means were reported in milliliters per minute (mL/min).
measure.population: All participants with ESRD maintained with hemodialysis

measurement_list.measurement: CLD for BMS-730823 was not determined since concentration in all dialysate samples were below Lower Level of Quantitation (LLOQ)

outcome.title: Percentage of Apixaban Extracted During Hemodialysis
outcome.description: The percentage of apixaban extracted during hemodialysis (extraction ratio) was calculated using the formula [plasma AUC(2-6) exiting - AUC(2-6) entering] / [AUC(2-6) entering] and converted to a percentage. The extraction ratio was measured in period 1 only, and was reported as a percentage.
outcome.population: All treated participants with ESRD maintained with hemodialysis

group.title: ESRD Maintained With Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) maintained with hemodialysis received two doses of apixaban separated by a washout period of at least 7 days; one oral dose of 5mg apixaban 2 hours prior to hemodialysis on Day 1 of Period 1, and a second oral dose of 5mg apixaban immediately following the hemodialysis session on Day 1, Period 2.

measure.title: Percentage of Apixaban Extracted During Hemodialysis
measure.description: The percentage of apixaban extracted during hemodialysis (extraction ratio) was calculated using the formula [plasma AUC(2-6) exiting - AUC(2-6) entering] / [AUC(2-6) entering] and converted to a percentage. The extraction ratio was measured in period 1 only, and was reported as a percentage.
measure.population: All treated participants with ESRD maintained with hemodialysis

outcome.title: Percentage of BMS-730823 Extracted During Hemodialysis
outcome.description: The percentage of BMS-730823 extracted during hemodialysis (extraction ratio) was calculated using the formula [plasma AUC(2-6)exiting - AUC(2-6)entering] / [AUC(2-6) entering] and converted to a percentage. The extraction ratio was measured in period 1 only, and was reported as a percentage.
outcome.population: All treated participants with ESRD maintained with hemodialysis

measure.title: Percentage of BMS-730823 Extracted During Hemodialysis
measure.description: The percentage of BMS-730823 extracted during hemodialysis (extraction ratio) was calculated using the formula [plasma AUC(2-6)exiting - AUC(2-6)entering] / [AUC(2-6) entering] and converted to a percentage. The extraction ratio was measured in period 1 only, and was reported as a percentage.
measure.population: All treated participants with ESRD maintained with hemodialysis

outcome.title: Mean Maximum Percent Change From Baseline International Normalized Ratio (INR) Following a Single 5 mg Oral Dose of Apixaban
outcome.description: The mean maximum percent change in baseline for INR was reported for each arm. Baseline measurements were assessed up to 24 hours prior to Day 1 dosing.
outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose

group.title: Normal Renal Function
group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function (calculated creatinine clearance (ClCr) > 80 mL/min) received a single oral dose of 5 mg apixaban on the morning of Day 1.

group.title: ESRD Dose Before Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with ESRD received one oral dose of 5 mg apixaban 2 hours prior to hemodialysis on Day 1.

group.title: ESRD Dose After Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with ESRD received one oral dose of 5 mg apixaban immediately following the completion of hemodialysis.

measure.title: Mean Maximum Percent Change From Baseline International Normalized Ratio (INR) Following a Single 5 mg Oral Dose of Apixaban
measure.description: The mean maximum percent change in baseline for INR was reported for each arm. Baseline measurements were assessed up to 24 hours prior to Day 1 dosing.

outcome.title: Mean Maximum Percent Change From Baseline Prothrombin Time (PT) Following a Single 5 mg Oral Dose of Apixaban
outcome.description: The mean maximum percent change in Prothrombin Time (PT) from baseline was reported for all treated participants. Baseline measurements were assessed up to 24 hours prior to Day 1 dosing.
outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose

measure.title: Mean Maximum Percent Change From Baseline Prothrombin Time (PT) Following a Single 5 mg Oral Dose of Apixaban
measure.description: The mean maximum percent change in Prothrombin Time (PT) from baseline was reported for all treated participants. Baseline measurements were assessed up to 24 hours prior to Day 1 dosing.

outcome.title: Mean Peak Anti-FXa Activity Following a Single Oral Dose of 5 mg Apixaban
outcome.description: Anti-FXa activity was assessed from an activity-time profile for doses both before and after hemodialysis. Maximal means were reported in International Units per milliliter (IU/mL).
outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose

measure.title: Mean Peak Anti-FXa Activity Following a Single Oral Dose of 5 mg Apixaban
measure.description: Anti-FXa activity was assessed from an activity-time profile for doses both before and after hemodialysis. Maximal means were reported in International Units per milliliter (IU/mL).

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Laboratory Marked Abnormalities
outcome.description: ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx= Baseline value. BUN=Blood Urea Nitrogen (mmol/L=millimoles per Liter): High if BUN > 1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx). Platelet count (*10^9 cell/L): Low if Platelet Count < 0.85*LLN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.85*Pre-Rx). Creatine (umol/L=micromoles per Liter): High if Creatine > 1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.33*Pre-Rx). Calcium, Total (mmol/L): High if Calcium > 1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.33*Pre-Rx). Potassium, serum (mmol/L): High if Potassium > 1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx; if Pre-Rx<LLN: >ULN). Phosphorus, Inorganic (mmol/L): Low if Phosphate < 0.85*LLN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: <LLN). Lactate dehydrogenase (U/L=Units per Liter): High if Lactate Dehydrogenase > 1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.5*Pre-Rx).
outcome.time_frame: From 24 hours pre-dose to 72 hours post-dose

group.title: Normal Renal Function
group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function (calculated creatinine clearance (ClCr) > 80 mL/min) received a single oral dose of 5 mg apixaban on the morning of Day 1.

group.title: ESRD Maintained With Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) maintained with hemodialysis received two doses of apixaban separated by a washout period of at least 7 days; one oral dose of 5mg apixaban 2 hours prior to hemodialysis on Day 1 of Period 1, and a second oral dose of 5mg apixaban immediately following the hemodialysis session on Day 1, Period 2.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Laboratory Marked Abnormalities
measure.description: ULN=Upper Limit of Normal, LLN=Lower Limit of Normal, Pre-Rx= Baseline value. BUN=Blood Urea Nitrogen (mmol/L=millimoles per Liter): High if BUN > 1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.25*Pre-Rx). Platelet count (*10^9 cell/L): Low if Platelet Count < 0.85*LLN (if Pre-Rx<LLN: <0.85*Pre-Rx). Creatine (umol/L=micromoles per Liter): High if Creatine > 1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.33*Pre-Rx). Calcium, Total (mmol/L): High if Calcium > 1.5*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.33*Pre-Rx). Potassium, serum (mmol/L): High if Potassium > 1.1*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.1*Pre-Rx; if Pre-Rx<LLN: >ULN). Phosphorus, Inorganic (mmol/L): Low if Phosphate < 0.85*LLN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: <LLN). Lactate dehydrogenase (U/L=Units per Liter): High if Lactate Dehydrogenase > 1.25*ULN (if Pre-Rx>ULN: >1.5*Pre-Rx).

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Died or Experienced Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) or Adverse Events Leading to Discontinuation
outcome.description: The number of participants who died or experienced SAEs or AEs leading to discontinuation was reported for each arm. AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization. Treatment-related=having certain, probable, possible, or missing relationship to study drug. Grade (Gr) 1=Mild, Gr 2=Moderate, Gr 3=Severe, Gr 4= Potentially Life-threatening or disabling.
outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to 30 days post study discontinuation

group.title: Normal Renal Function
group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function (calculated creatinine clearance (ClCr) > 80 mL/min) received a single oral dose of 5 mg apixaban on the morning of Day 1.

group.title: ESRD Maintained With Hemodialysis
group.description: Participants with End Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) maintained with hemodialysis received two doses of apixaban separated by a washout period of at least 7 days; one oral dose of 5mg apixaban 2 hours prior to hemodialysis on Day 1 of Period 1, and a second oral dose of 5mg apixaban immediately following the hemodialysis session on Day 1, Period 2.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Died or Experienced Serious Adverse Events (SAEs) or Adverse Events Leading to Discontinuation
measure.description: The number of participants who died or experienced SAEs or AEs leading to discontinuation was reported for each arm. AE=any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a preexisting condition that may not have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE=a medical event that at any dose results in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; is life-threatening, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or requires or prolongs hospitalization. Treatment-related=having certain, probable, possible, or missing relationship to study drug. Grade (Gr) 1=Mild, Gr 2=Moderate, Gr 3=Severe, Gr 4= Potentially Life-threatening or disabling.

reported_events.time_frame: From Day 1 until 30 days post discontinuation, up to September 2011 (approximately 3 months)
reported_events.desc: Study initiated: June 2011 Study completed: September 2011 Participants underwent regular laboratory testing and investigator assessment as outlined in the study protocol.

group.description: Healthy participants with normal renal function (calculated creatinine clearance (ClCr) > 80 mL/min) received a single oral dose of 5 mg apixaban on the morning of Day 1.

group.description: Participants with ESRD received one oral dose of 5 mg apixaban 2 hours prior to hemodialysis on Day 1.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period 60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
